p:
The yellow fever virus (YFV) is a member of the Flaviviridae family and transmitted by sylvan mosquitoes of the genus Haemagogus and Sabethes, in South America and Aedes aegypti in urban settings 5 â€“ 8 .
Also in this paragraph (lines 9-12), state that there was (thankfully) no evidence of urban transmission during these outbreaks.
